definition: precepts regarding what is honorable and what is shameful (in particular, refers to the Socialist Concepts on Honors and Disgraces, PRC official moral principles promulgated from 2006)/abbr. for 社會主義榮辱觀|社会主义荣辱观/also known as the Eight Honors and Eight Shames 八榮八恥|八荣八耻[Ba1 Rong2 Ba1 Chi3]
disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

sentences.english: There is stronger sense of responsibility, with society honor versus dishonor view.
sentences.chinese: 有較強的責任感，和社會榮辱觀。

sentences.english: In implementing the socialist outlook on honor-dishonor, we must catch on the key points.
sentences.chinese: 落實社會主義榮辱觀應當把握住關鍵。

sentences.english: His view of shame is of great value for the construction of the contemporary concepts of honor and disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 顧炎武的“恥德”觀對當代榮辱觀建設具有啓示意義。

sentences.english: Fourth, the socialist concept of honor is the ideological and political education foundation.
sentences.chinese: 四是社會主義榮辱觀是大學生思想政治教育的基礎。

sentences.english: Mencius is rich in outlook on what are honor and dishonors.
sentences.chinese: 《孟子》中的榮辱觀豐富而深刻。

sentences.english: The knowledge and action is the key to educating on people's concept of honors and disgraces.
sentences.chinese: “知”與“行”是公民榮辱觀教育的關鍵環節。

sentences.english: Today the topic that I make a speech is" our honor versus dishonor in the heart view".
sentences.chinese: 今天我演講的題目是“我們心中的榮辱觀”。

sentences.english: The concept of honor and disgrace is the basic views and attitudes on honor and disgrace of people.
sentences.chinese: 榮辱觀是人們對榮譽和恥辱的根本看法和態度。
